content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a four row table, with four columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “h of x.” The heading for row 3 is “h prime of x.” The heading for row 4 is “h double prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 1. h of x is 3. h prime of x is 4. h double prime of x is negative 5. Column 2. x is 2. h of x is 6. h prime of x is negative 4. h double prime of x is 2. Column 3. x is 3. h of x is 2. h prime of x is 3. h double prime of x is 1. Column 4. x is 4. h of x is 10. h prime of x is 5. h double prime of x is 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Selected values of the twice-differentiable function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its first and second derivatives are given in the table above. What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, x times, h double prime of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 6.11: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Integration by Parts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
